title: Reciprocal trigonometric functions (sec, csc, cot)
content: Define the traditional reciprocal trigonometric functions secant (sec), cosecant (csc), and cotangent (cos), along with various identities involving them.

blocks.name: csec
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include the secant function, see ~ df-sec .
blocks.origin: const class csec { sec }

blocks.name: diff.csec.s
diff.csec.c
diff.csec.w
ccsc
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include the cosecant function, see ~ df-csc .
blocks.origin: const class ccsc { csc }

blocks.name: diff.ccsc.s
diff.ccsc.c
diff.ccsc.w
ccot
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include the cotangent function, see ~ df-cot .
blocks.origin: const class ccot { cot }

blocks.name: diff.ccot.s
diff.ccot.c
diff.ccot.w
df-sec
blocks.content: Define the secant function. We define it this way for ~ cmpt , which requires the form ` ( x e. A |-> B ) ` . The sec function is defined in ISO 80000-2:2009(E) operation 2-13.6 and "NIST Digital Library of Mathematical Functions" section on "Trigonometric Functions" ~ http://dlmf.nist.gov/4.14 (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 14-Mar-2014.)

blocks.name: df-csc
blocks.content: Define the cosecant function. We define it this way for ~ cmpt , which requires the form ` ( x e. A |-> B ) ` . The csc function is defined in ISO 80000-2:2009(E) operation 2-13.7 and "NIST Digital Library of Mathematical Functions" section on "Trigonometric Functions" ~ http://dlmf.nist.gov/4.14 (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 14-Mar-2014.)

blocks.name: df-cot
blocks.content: Define the cotangent function. We define it this way for ~ cmpt , which requires the form ` ( x e. A |-> B ) ` . The cot function is defined in ISO 80000-2:2009(E) operation 2-13.5 and "NIST Digital Library of Mathematical Functions" section on "Trigonometric Functions" ~ http://dlmf.nist.gov/4.14 (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 14-Mar-2014.)

blocks.name: secval
blocks.content: Value of the secant function. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 14-Mar-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm secval(class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0)), wceq(cfv(csec, c0), co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0))))
} = {
  sylbir(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0)), wceq(cfv(csec, c0), co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0))), wcel(c0, crab(hs0, cc, wne(cfv(ccos, cv(hs0)), nat0))))
  elrab(hs0, c0, cc, wne(cfv(ccos, cv(hs0)), nat0), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0))
  neeq1d(cfv(ccos, cv(hs0)), nat0, cfv(ccos, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, ccos)
  fvmpt(hs1, c0, crab(hs0, cc, wne(cfv(ccos, cv(hs0)), nat0)), csec, co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0)), co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ccos, cv(hs1))))
  oveq2d(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ccos, cv(hs1)), cfv(ccos, c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs1), c0, ccos)
  df-sec(hs1, hs0)
  ovex(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.w(wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(crab(hs0, cc, wne(cfv(ccos, cv(hs0)), nat0)))
  diff.hs1.c(co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0)))
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm secval(class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(cos ` c0)≠ 0)→(sec ` c0)=(1[÷](cos ` c0)))
} = {
  sylbir((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(cos ` c0)≠ 0), (sec ` c0)=(1[÷](cos ` c0)), c0 ∈ { hs0 ∈ ℂ |(cos ` hs0)≠ 0 })
  elrab(hs0, c0, cc, (cos ` hs0)≠ 0, (cos ` c0)≠ 0)
  neeq1d((cos ` hs0), nat0, (cos ` c0), hs0 = c0)
  fveq2(hs0, c0, ccos)
  fvmpt(hs1, c0, { hs0 ∈ ℂ |(cos ` hs0)≠ 0 }, csec, (1[÷](cos ` c0)), (1[÷](cos ` hs1)))
  oveq2d(nat1, cdiv, (cos ` hs1), (cos ` c0), hs1 = c0)
  fveq2(hs1, c0, ccos)
  df-sec(hs1, hs0)
  ovex(nat1, cdiv, (cos ` c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.w((cos ` c0)≠ 0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c({ hs0 ∈ ℂ |(cos ` hs0)≠ 0 })
  diff.hs1.c((1[÷](cos ` c0)))
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
}

blocks.name: cscval
blocks.content: Value of the cosecant function. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 14-Mar-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm cscval(class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0)), wceq(cfv(ccsc, c0), co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))))
} = {
  sylbir(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0)), wceq(cfv(ccsc, c0), co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))), wcel(c0, crab(hs0, cc, wne(cfv(csin, cv(hs0)), nat0))))
  elrab(hs0, c0, cc, wne(cfv(csin, cv(hs0)), nat0), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0))
  neeq1d(cfv(csin, cv(hs0)), nat0, cfv(csin, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, csin)
  fvmpt(hs1, c0, crab(hs0, cc, wne(cfv(csin, cv(hs0)), nat0)), ccsc, co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(csin, c0)), co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(csin, cv(hs1))))
  oveq2d(nat1, cdiv, cfv(csin, cv(hs1)), cfv(csin, c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs1), c0, csin)
  df-csc(hs1, hs0)
  ovex(nat1, cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.w(wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(crab(hs0, cc, wne(cfv(csin, cv(hs0)), nat0)))
  diff.hs1.c(co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(csin, c0)))
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm cscval(class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(sin ` c0)≠ 0)→(csc ` c0)=(1[÷](sin ` c0)))
} = {
  sylbir((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(sin ` c0)≠ 0), (csc ` c0)=(1[÷](sin ` c0)), c0 ∈ { hs0 ∈ ℂ |(sin ` hs0)≠ 0 })
  elrab(hs0, c0, cc, (sin ` hs0)≠ 0, (sin ` c0)≠ 0)
  neeq1d((sin ` hs0), nat0, (sin ` c0), hs0 = c0)
  fveq2(hs0, c0, csin)
  fvmpt(hs1, c0, { hs0 ∈ ℂ |(sin ` hs0)≠ 0 }, ccsc, (1[÷](sin ` c0)), (1[÷](sin ` hs1)))
  oveq2d(nat1, cdiv, (sin ` hs1), (sin ` c0), hs1 = c0)
  fveq2(hs1, c0, csin)
  df-csc(hs1, hs0)
  ovex(nat1, cdiv, (sin ` c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.w((sin ` c0)≠ 0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c({ hs0 ∈ ℂ |(sin ` hs0)≠ 0 })
  diff.hs1.c((1[÷](sin ` c0)))
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
}

blocks.name: cotval
blocks.content: Value of the cotangent function. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 14-Mar-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm cotval(class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0)), wceq(cfv(ccot, c0), co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))))
} = {
  sylbir(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0)), wceq(cfv(ccot, c0), co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))), wcel(c0, crab(hs0, cc, wne(cfv(csin, cv(hs0)), nat0))))
  elrab(hs0, c0, cc, wne(cfv(csin, cv(hs0)), nat0), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0))
  neeq1d(cfv(csin, cv(hs0)), nat0, cfv(csin, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, csin)
  fvmpt(hs1, c0, crab(hs0, cc, wne(cfv(csin, cv(hs0)), nat0)), ccot, co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0)), co(cfv(ccos, cv(hs1)), cdiv, cfv(csin, cv(hs1))))
  oveq12d(cfv(ccos, cv(hs1)), cdiv, cfv(csin, cv(hs1)), cfv(ccos, c0), cfv(csin, c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs1), c0, ccos)
  fveq2(cv(hs1), c0, csin)
  df-cot(hs1, hs0)
  ovex(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.w(wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(crab(hs0, cc, wne(cfv(csin, cv(hs0)), nat0)))
  diff.hs1.c(co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0)))
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm cotval(class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(sin ` c0)≠ 0)→(cot ` c0)=((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0)))
} = {
  sylbir((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(sin ` c0)≠ 0), (cot ` c0)=((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0)), c0 ∈ { hs0 ∈ ℂ |(sin ` hs0)≠ 0 })
  elrab(hs0, c0, cc, (sin ` hs0)≠ 0, (sin ` c0)≠ 0)
  neeq1d((sin ` hs0), nat0, (sin ` c0), hs0 = c0)
  fveq2(hs0, c0, csin)
  fvmpt(hs1, c0, { hs0 ∈ ℂ |(sin ` hs0)≠ 0 }, ccot, ((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0)), ((cos ` hs1)[÷](sin ` hs1)))
  oveq12d((cos ` hs1), cdiv, (sin ` hs1), (cos ` c0), (sin ` c0), hs1 = c0)
  fveq2(hs1, c0, ccos)
  fveq2(hs1, c0, csin)
  df-cot(hs1, hs0)
  ovex((cos ` c0), cdiv, (sin ` c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.w((sin ` c0)≠ 0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c({ hs0 ∈ ℂ |(sin ` hs0)≠ 0 })
  diff.hs1.c(((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0)))
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
}

blocks.name: seccl
blocks.content: The closure of the secant function with a complex argument. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 14-Mar-2014.)

blocks.name: csccl
blocks.content: The closure of the cosecant function with a complex argument. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 14-Mar-2014.)

blocks.name: cotcl
blocks.content: The closure of the cotangent function with a complex argument. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 15-Mar-2014.)

blocks.name: reseccl
blocks.content: The closure of the secant function with a real argument. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 15-Mar-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm reseccl(class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0)), wcel(cfv(csec, c0), cr))
} = {
  eqeltrd(cfv(csec, c0), cr, co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0)))
  sylan(wcel(c0, cr), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0), wceq(cfv(csec, c0), co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0))), wcel(c0, cc))
  recn(c0)
  secval(c0)
  3anidm12(wcel(c0, cr), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0), wcel(co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0)), cr))
  syl3an2(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c0, cr), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0), wcel(co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0)), cr), wcel(cfv(ccos, c0), cr))
  recoscl(c0)
  syl3an1(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cfv(ccos, c0), cr), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0), wcel(co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0)), cr), wcel(nat1, cr))
  1red(wcel(c0, cr))
  redivcl(nat1, cfv(ccos, c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm reseccl(class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧(cos ` c0)≠ 0)→(sec ` c0)∈ ℝ)
} = {
  eqeltrd((sec ` c0), cr, (1[÷](cos ` c0)), (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧(cos ` c0)≠ 0))
  sylan(c0 ∈ ℝ, (cos ` c0)≠ 0, (sec ` c0)=(1[÷](cos ` c0)), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  recn(c0)
  secval(c0)
  3anidm12(c0 ∈ ℝ, (cos ` c0)≠ 0, (1[÷](cos ` c0))∈ ℝ)
  syl3an2(c0 ∈ ℝ, c0 ∈ ℝ, (cos ` c0)≠ 0, (1[÷](cos ` c0))∈ ℝ, (cos ` c0)∈ ℝ)
  recoscl(c0)
  syl3an1(c0 ∈ ℝ, (cos ` c0)∈ ℝ, (cos ` c0)≠ 0, (1[÷](cos ` c0))∈ ℝ, 1 ∈ ℝ)
  1red(c0 ∈ ℝ)
  redivcl(nat1, (cos ` c0))
}

blocks.name: recsccl
blocks.content: The closure of the cosecant function with a real argument. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 15-Mar-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm recsccl(class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0)), wcel(cfv(ccsc, c0), cr))
} = {
  eqeltrd(cfv(ccsc, c0), cr, co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(csin, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0)))
  sylan(wcel(c0, cr), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wceq(cfv(ccsc, c0), co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))), wcel(c0, cc))
  recn(c0)
  cscval(c0)
  3anidm12(wcel(c0, cr), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wcel(co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(csin, c0)), cr))
  syl3an2(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c0, cr), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wcel(co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(csin, c0)), cr), wcel(cfv(csin, c0), cr))
  resincl(c0)
  syl3an1(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cfv(csin, c0), cr), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wcel(co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(csin, c0)), cr), wcel(nat1, cr))
  1red(wcel(c0, cr))
  redivcl(nat1, cfv(csin, c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm recsccl(class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧(sin ` c0)≠ 0)→(csc ` c0)∈ ℝ)
} = {
  eqeltrd((csc ` c0), cr, (1[÷](sin ` c0)), (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧(sin ` c0)≠ 0))
  sylan(c0 ∈ ℝ, (sin ` c0)≠ 0, (csc ` c0)=(1[÷](sin ` c0)), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  recn(c0)
  cscval(c0)
  3anidm12(c0 ∈ ℝ, (sin ` c0)≠ 0, (1[÷](sin ` c0))∈ ℝ)
  syl3an2(c0 ∈ ℝ, c0 ∈ ℝ, (sin ` c0)≠ 0, (1[÷](sin ` c0))∈ ℝ, (sin ` c0)∈ ℝ)
  resincl(c0)
  syl3an1(c0 ∈ ℝ, (sin ` c0)∈ ℝ, (sin ` c0)≠ 0, (1[÷](sin ` c0))∈ ℝ, 1 ∈ ℝ)
  1red(c0 ∈ ℝ)
  redivcl(nat1, (sin ` c0))
}

blocks.name: recotcl
blocks.content: The closure of the cotangent function with a real argument. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 15-Mar-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm recotcl(class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0)), wcel(cfv(ccot, c0), cr))
} = {
  eqeltrd(cfv(ccot, c0), cr, co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0)))
  sylan(wcel(c0, cr), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wceq(cfv(ccot, c0), co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))), wcel(c0, cc))
  recn(c0)
  cotval(c0)
  3anidm12(wcel(c0, cr), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wcel(co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0)), cr))
  syl3an2(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c0, cr), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wcel(co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0)), cr), wcel(cfv(csin, c0), cr))
  resincl(c0)
  syl3an1(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cfv(csin, c0), cr), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wcel(co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0)), cr), wcel(cfv(ccos, c0), cr))
  recoscl(c0)
  redivcl(cfv(ccos, c0), cfv(csin, c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm recotcl(class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧(sin ` c0)≠ 0)→(cot ` c0)∈ ℝ)
} = {
  eqeltrd((cot ` c0), cr, ((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0)), (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧(sin ` c0)≠ 0))
  sylan(c0 ∈ ℝ, (sin ` c0)≠ 0, (cot ` c0)=((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0)), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  recn(c0)
  cotval(c0)
  3anidm12(c0 ∈ ℝ, (sin ` c0)≠ 0, ((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0))∈ ℝ)
  syl3an2(c0 ∈ ℝ, c0 ∈ ℝ, (sin ` c0)≠ 0, ((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0))∈ ℝ, (sin ` c0)∈ ℝ)
  resincl(c0)
  syl3an1(c0 ∈ ℝ, (sin ` c0)∈ ℝ, (sin ` c0)≠ 0, ((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0))∈ ℝ, (cos ` c0)∈ ℝ)
  recoscl(c0)
  redivcl((cos ` c0), (sin ` c0))
}

blocks.name: recsec
blocks.content: The reciprocal of secant is cosine. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 14-Mar-2014.)

blocks.name: reccsc
blocks.content: The reciprocal of cosecant is sine. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 14-Mar-2014.)

blocks.name: reccot
blocks.content: The reciprocal of cotangent is tangent. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 21-Mar-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm reccot(class c0) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0)), wceq(cfv(ctan, c0), co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ccot, c0))))
} = {
  3eqtr4rd(cfv(ctan, c0), co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ccot, c0)), co(nat1, cdiv, co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))), co(cfv(csin, c0), cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0)), w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0)))
  3com23(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0), wceq(co(nat1, cdiv, co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))), co(cfv(csin, c0), cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0))))
  3impdi(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wceq(co(nat1, cdiv, co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))), co(cfv(csin, c0), cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0))))
  sylanr1(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0)), wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wceq(co(nat1, cdiv, co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))), co(cfv(csin, c0), cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0))), wcel(cfv(csin, c0), cc))
  sincl(c0)
  sylanl1(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0), wa(wcel(cfv(csin, c0), cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0)), wceq(co(nat1, cdiv, co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))), co(cfv(csin, c0), cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0))), wcel(cfv(ccos, c0), cc))
  coscl(c0)
  recdiv(cfv(ccos, c0), cfv(csin, c0))
  oveq2d(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ccot, c0), co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0)), w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0)))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0), wceq(cfv(ccot, c0), co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))))
  cotval(c0)
  3adant2(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0), wceq(cfv(ctan, c0), co(cfv(csin, c0), cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0))))
  tanval(c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm reccot(class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(sin ` c0)≠ 0 ∧(cos ` c0)≠ 0)→(tan ` c0)=(1[÷](cot ` c0)))
} = {
  3eqtr4rd((tan ` c0), (1[÷](cot ` c0)), (1[÷]((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0))), ((sin ` c0)[÷](cos ` c0)), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(sin ` c0)≠ 0 ∧(cos ` c0)≠ 0))
  3com23(c0 ∈ ℂ, (sin ` c0)≠ 0, (cos ` c0)≠ 0, (1[÷]((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0)))=((sin ` c0)[÷](cos ` c0)))
  3impdi(c0 ∈ ℂ, (cos ` c0)≠ 0, (sin ` c0)≠ 0, (1[÷]((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0)))=((sin ` c0)[÷](cos ` c0)))
  sylanr1((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(cos ` c0)≠ 0), c0 ∈ ℂ, (sin ` c0)≠ 0, (1[÷]((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0)))=((sin ` c0)[÷](cos ` c0)), (sin ` c0)∈ ℂ)
  sincl(c0)
  sylanl1(c0 ∈ ℂ, (cos ` c0)≠ 0, ((sin ` c0)∈ ℂ ∧(sin ` c0)≠ 0), (1[÷]((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0)))=((sin ` c0)[÷](cos ` c0)), (cos ` c0)∈ ℂ)
  coscl(c0)
  recdiv((cos ` c0), (sin ` c0))
  oveq2d(nat1, cdiv, (cot ` c0), ((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0)), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(sin ` c0)≠ 0 ∧(cos ` c0)≠ 0))
  3adant3(c0 ∈ ℂ, (sin ` c0)≠ 0, (cos ` c0)≠ 0, (cot ` c0)=((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0)))
  cotval(c0)
  3adant2(c0 ∈ ℂ, (sin ` c0)≠ 0, (cos ` c0)≠ 0, (tan ` c0)=((sin ` c0)[÷](cos ` c0)))
  tanval(c0)
}

blocks.name: rectan
blocks.content: The reciprocal of tangent is cotangent. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 21-Mar-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm rectan(class c0) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0)), wceq(cfv(ccot, c0), co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ctan, c0))))
} = {
  3eqtr4rd(cfv(ccot, c0), co(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ctan, c0)), co(nat1, cdiv, co(cfv(csin, c0), cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0))), co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0)), w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0)))
  3impdi(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0), wceq(co(nat1, cdiv, co(cfv(csin, c0), cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0))), co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))))
  sylanr1(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0)), wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0), wceq(co(nat1, cdiv, co(cfv(csin, c0), cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0))), co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))), wcel(cfv(ccos, c0), cc))
  coscl(c0)
  sylanl1(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wa(wcel(cfv(ccos, c0), cc), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0)), wceq(co(nat1, cdiv, co(cfv(csin, c0), cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0))), co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))), wcel(cfv(csin, c0), cc))
  sincl(c0)
  recdiv(cfv(csin, c0), cfv(ccos, c0))
  oveq2d(nat1, cdiv, cfv(ctan, c0), co(cfv(csin, c0), cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0)), w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0)))
  3adant2(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0), wceq(cfv(ctan, c0), co(cfv(csin, c0), cdiv, cfv(ccos, c0))))
  tanval(c0)
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wne(cfv(ccos, c0), nat0), wceq(cfv(ccot, c0), co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0))))
  cotval(c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm rectan(class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(sin ` c0)≠ 0 ∧(cos ` c0)≠ 0)→(cot ` c0)=(1[÷](tan ` c0)))
} = {
  3eqtr4rd((cot ` c0), (1[÷](tan ` c0)), (1[÷]((sin ` c0)[÷](cos ` c0))), ((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0)), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(sin ` c0)≠ 0 ∧(cos ` c0)≠ 0))
  3impdi(c0 ∈ ℂ, (sin ` c0)≠ 0, (cos ` c0)≠ 0, (1[÷]((sin ` c0)[÷](cos ` c0)))=((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0)))
  sylanr1((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(sin ` c0)≠ 0), c0 ∈ ℂ, (cos ` c0)≠ 0, (1[÷]((sin ` c0)[÷](cos ` c0)))=((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0)), (cos ` c0)∈ ℂ)
  coscl(c0)
  sylanl1(c0 ∈ ℂ, (sin ` c0)≠ 0, ((cos ` c0)∈ ℂ ∧(cos ` c0)≠ 0), (1[÷]((sin ` c0)[÷](cos ` c0)))=((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0)), (sin ` c0)∈ ℂ)
  sincl(c0)
  recdiv((sin ` c0), (cos ` c0))
  oveq2d(nat1, cdiv, (tan ` c0), ((sin ` c0)[÷](cos ` c0)), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(sin ` c0)≠ 0 ∧(cos ` c0)≠ 0))
  3adant2(c0 ∈ ℂ, (sin ` c0)≠ 0, (cos ` c0)≠ 0, (tan ` c0)=((sin ` c0)[÷](cos ` c0)))
  tanval(c0)
  3adant3(c0 ∈ ℂ, (sin ` c0)≠ 0, (cos ` c0)≠ 0, (cot ` c0)=((cos ` c0)[÷](sin ` c0)))
  cotval(c0)
}

blocks.name: sec0
blocks.content: The value of the secant function at zero is one. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 16-Mar-2014.)

blocks.name: cotsqcscsq
blocks.content: Prove the tangent squared cosecant squared identity ` ( 1 + ( ( cot ` A ) ^ 2 ) ) = ( ( csc ` A ) ^ 2 ) ) ` . (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 27-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm cotsqcscsq(class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0)), wceq(co(nat1, caddc, co(cfv(ccot, c0), cexp, nat2)), co(cfv(ccsc, c0), cexp, nat2)))
} = {
  eqtr4d(co(nat1, caddc, co(cfv(ccot, c0), cexp, nat2)), co(cfv(ccsc, c0), cexp, nat2), co(nat1, caddc, co(co(cfv(ccos, c0), cdiv, cfv(csin, c0)), cexp, nat2)), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0)))

  cotval(c0)

  adantr(wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(csin, c0), nat0), wceq(co(co(co(cfv(csin, c0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cfv(ccos, c0), cexp, nat2)), cdiv, co(cfv(csin, c0), cexp, nat2)), co(nat1, cdiv, co(cfv(csin, c0), cexp, nat2))))
